intro: Dortmanna alpina, commonly known as the alpine Dortmanna, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to mountainous regions in Europe and Asia, typically growing in alpine meadows and rocky soils. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. It is adapted to cold climates and can withstand harsh environmental conditions. Dortmanna alpina is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ecological benefits in alpine ecosystems.
